column2: The IRB Consultant is crucial in providing expertise and guidance to researchers and institutions to ensure compliance with ethical standards and regulatory requirements in human subjects research        The consultant is responsible for offering support throughout the research process, from protocol development to ongoing monitoring and compliance                 ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:                Collaborate with researchers to review and refine research protocols to meet ethical standards and regulatory obligations.              Assess risk-benefit analyses and ensure the protection of human subjects.              Assist in the preparation of informed consent forms and other relevant documentation.              Provide expertise during IRB meetings, addressing ethical considerations and regulatory compliance.              Collaborate with IRB members to address questions or concerns related to research proposals.              Assist in developing and updating institutional policies related to human subjects research.                  EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:                Advanced degree in a relevant field (e.g., bioethics, public health, social sciences).              Strong communication and interpersonal skills.              Detail-oriented with the ability to analyze complex research protocols.                  PREFERRED SKILLS:                Experience in reviewing IRB applications and clinical research protocols.              Previous experience serving on or working with an IRB is highly desirable.              Knowledge of US Federal IRB regulations, policies, and procedures regarding human subjects research protection programs and approval to conduct research.              Excellent writing skills, including generating clear, precise, detailed study reviews.                  COMPENSATION & BENEFITS:          Contractors earn Hourly Wages with Sitero. Contractors are not eligible for full-time benefits, time off, or other full-time benefits that Sitero offers.

column2: Fortis Healthcare Ltd  is looking for Oncology Nurse  to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey.The Oncology Nurse plays a crucial role in the care and treatment of patients with cancer. They provide compassionate and comprehensive nursing care to individuals undergoing cancer treatment, including chemotherapy, radiation therapy, and other forms of treatment. The role requires a strong understanding of oncology nursing principles, excellent communication skills, and the ability to work collaboratively within a multidisciplinary healthcare team. Key Responsibilities: Patient Assessment and Care: Conduct thorough assessments of patients with cancer, including physical, psychological, and emotional needs. Develop individualized care plans in collaboration with the healthcare team to address patient needs throughout the cancer treatment process. Administration of Treatments: Administer chemotherapy, immunotherapy, and other medications as prescribed by oncologists. Monitor patients during treatment for adverse reactions and provide appropriate interventions as necessary. Educate patients and their families about treatment regimens, potential side effects, and self-care techniques. Symptom Management: Manage cancer-related symptoms such as pain, nausea, fatigue, and other side effects of treatment. Utilize evidence-based practices and guidelines to provide effective symptom relief and improve patient comfort. Patient Education: Provide comprehensive education to patients and their families about cancer diagnosis, treatment options, and supportive care resources. Empower patients to participate in decision-making regarding their care and encourage adherence to treatment plans. Emotional Support: Offer emotional support and counseling to patients and families coping with a cancer diagnosis. Foster a supportive and empathetic environment to address psychological and emotional concerns throughout the cancer journey. Collaboration and Communication: Collaborate effectively with oncologists, radiation therapists, surgeons, social workers, and other healthcare professionals to coordinate patient care. Communicate patient progress, treatment updates, and concerns within the healthcare team to ensure continuity of care. Documentation and Record-Keeping: Maintain accurate and thorough documentation of patient assessments, care plans, interventions, and outcomes in compliance with regulatory standards and institutional policies. Patient Advocacy: Advocate for the needs and preferences of patients within the healthcare system. Serve as a liaison between patients, families, and healthcare providers to ensure that patient concerns are addressed and rights are respected.
column11: Oncology, Nurse

collaboration with interdisciplinary teams         Responsibilities         Diagnose and assess cancer patients through comprehensive medical evaluations and diagnostic tests     Develop personalized treatment plans based on the patient's medical history, disease stage, and individual preferences     Provide patients and their families with clear explanations of treatment options, potential risks, and expected outcomes     Administer chemotherapy, immunotherapy, targeted therapy, and other medical treatments as appropriate     Monitor patient response to treatment and adjust therapy plans as needed     Collaborate closely with radiation oncologists, surgical oncologists, and other specialists to ensure comprehensive care     Lead multidisciplinary tumor board discussions to discuss column2: Educational   Background:  MD/DM (Medical Oncology) / DNB (Medical Oncology) from a recognized institution.  Job   Description: Position   Overview:  We are seeking a highly skilled and dedicated Medical Oncology Doctor to join our esteemed medical team. The successful candidate will provide comprehensive care to patients with cancer, including diagnosis, treatment, and follow-up. This role is ideal for a compassionate professional committed to improving patient outcomes through evidence- based care and continuous learning. Key   Responsibilities: 1.  Patient   Care: o Diagnose and treat various types of cancers using chemotherapy, hormonal therapy, biological therapy, and targeted therapy. o Develop and implement individualized treatment plans in collaboration with a multidisciplinary team. o Monitor patients progress throughout treatment and adjust therapies as necessary. Manage symptoms and side effects of cancer and its treatment, providing  supportive care to enhance patients quality of life. 2.  Clinical   Duties: o Perform comprehensive assessments, including history taking, physical examinations, and interpretation of diagnostic tests. o Prescribe and administer chemotherapy and other oncological treatments in accordance with established protocols. o Conduct follow-up appointments to monitor patients for treatment response, recurrence, and long-term effects of therapy. o Maintain accurate and detailed medical records for all patients. 3.  Multidisciplinary   Collaboration: o Work closely with surgical oncologists, radiation oncologists, radiologists,  pathologists, and other healthcare professionals to ensure integrated patient  care. o Participate in tumor boards and case discussions to formulate optimal treatment plans. o Communicate effectively with patients and their families about diagnosis, treatment options, and prognosis.  4.  Research   and   Education: o Participate in clinical research and contribute to advancements in the field of medical oncology. o Publish research findings in peer-reviewed journals and present at medical conferences. o Provide education and training to medical students, residents, and junior doctors. o Engage in continuous professional development and stay updated with the latest advancements in oncology.  5.  Administrative   Duties: o Adhere to hospital policies, procedures, and regulatory standards. o Participate in departmental meetings and contribute to the development of  clinical guidelines and protocols. o Engage in quality improvement initiatives to enhance patient care and operational efficiency. Qualifications   and   Skills: ?? Experience:  Minimum 10-20 years of experience in the field of medical oncology. ?? Clinical   Expertise:  Proficiency in diagnosing and treating various cancers with a  range of therapeutic modalities. ?? Patient   Care:  Strong commitment to patient-centered care with excellent clinical judgment and problem-solving skills. ?? Research:  Experience in clinical research with a track record of publications and presentations. ?? Communication:  Excellent interpersonal and communication skills to interact  effectively with patients, families, and the healthcare team. ?? Team   Collaboration:  Ability to work collaboratively within a multidisciplinary team  environment. ?? column2: Patient Evaluation: Conduct comprehensive medical assessments and evaluations of cancer patients, including reviewing medical histories, physical examinations, and diagnostic tests      Treatment Planning: Collaborate with senior oncologists to develop and implement treatment plans for cancer patients      This may include chemotherapy, targeted therapies, immunotherapies, and other treatment modalities      Chemotherapy Administration: Administer chemotherapy and other cancer treatments, monitoring patients for potential side effects and adjusting treatment plans as needed      Patient Education: Educate patients and their families about their cancer diagnosis, treatment options, potential side effects, and supportive care measures      Clinical Research: Participate in clinical trials and research projects related to oncology, contributing to the advancement of cancer treatment options      Multidisciplinary Team Collaboration: Work as part of a multidisciplinary team that includes surgeons, radiation oncologists, nurses, and other healthcare professionals to provide comprehensive cancer care      Medical Records and Documentation: Maintain accurate and detailed medical records of patient consultations, treatment plans, and progress      Follow-Up Care: Monitor patients during and after treatment, providing ongoing support and adjusting treatment plans as necessary
